title: Synthetic Recap
body:
PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) — On a night where defense was supposed to reign, Shawn Kemp authored a masterpiece of sheer, unadulterated power.

The Seattle SuperSonics’ forward, known as the "Reign Man," delivered a historic performance, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 49 points to single-handedly dismantle the Portland Trail Blazers in a bruising 91-83 victory.

From the opening tip, this was a Kemp showcase. He was an unstoppable force, operating with a devastating blend of finesse and fury against a helpless Portland frontcourt. His final line was one for the ages: 49 points on a hyper-efficient 18-of-29 shooting from the field, a staggering 20 rebounds, and 4 assists. Every clutch basket, every authoritative board, silenced a once-raucous Memorial Coliseum crowd.

While the Trail Blazers, led by Isaiah Rider's 22 points, kept the score respectable, they had no answer for the hurricane in green and gold. Kemp’s dominance inside opened the floor for his teammates, though none needed to contribute heavily on this night. It was a one-man wrecking crew.

The game was not a shootout; it was a physical grind, which made Kemp’s output all the more remarkable. In a contest that finished with a football-like final score, he was the lone offensive engine, accounting for well over half of his team’s points.

When the final horn sounded, the significance was clear. This wasn't just a road win; it was a coronation. Shawn Kemp had not only carried his team to a crucial victory but had also etched his name atop the Seattle SuperSonics record books in one of the most dominant individual displays the franchise has ever witnessed.
